item.title: [C4D] Nintendo DS **Finished**
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:44, topic:213063”]You might want to. And do it for the buttons too. Because it looks almost perfect (that is with me not looking at any references, looks like a nice model) except for that fact. The buttons and dpad look like little bubbles sitting on top of it.

Btw, how did you do the speaker holes?[/quote]
cylinders grouped into a null object put into a bool, the top and bottom are 2 different bools.

Cruzer:

The speaker holes on the right of the DS are more spread out then the left.

i fx it 2

item.title: [C4D] Nintendo DS **Finished**
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:42, topic:213063”]Well is the bottom of it touching or going through the DS?

Either way, I suggest modeling DOWN the DS for the dpad. Kinda like a boolean.

But do it yourself because booleans are disgusting.[/quote]
I actually thought of that, there is space around the keys. And yes right now its going all the way through

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Nintendo DS **Finished**
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Well is the bottom of it touching or going through the DS?

Either way, I suggest modeling DOWN the DS for the dpad. Kinda like a boolean.

But do it yourself because booleans are disgusting.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Nintendo DS **Finished**
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:40, topic:213063”]Much much better, you’re actually getting a lot better at this if you don’t realize it.

But your phong shading is messed up.

Are the dpad/buttons connected to the body? Or not? If they are, split them, or turn phong shading down to 35[/quote]
I realize im getting better, im using more lighting, and looking at things in real life

dpad is not connected, its a cube with sections on its side extruded.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Nintendo DS **Finished**
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Much much better, you’re actually getting a lot better at this if you don’t realize it.

But your phong shading is messed up.

Are the dpad/buttons connected to the body? Or not? If they are, split them, or turn phong shading down to 35

better, but th lite isn’t round like that, a bit sharper.

item.title: [C4D] Nintendo DS **Finished**
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

try and use some good reference images when you can. it can really help a lot.

but looks good, but I think to make it look more realistic, you should sort out a really small scene and get some nice lighting going with optimum render settings. There are some good render engines about you can find through torrenting, and getting used to them and learning what everything does helps in making the best scenes.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Nintendo DS **Finished**

item.description:

Wow, imo it looks great

And that’s why you’re the creator of SCAR Divi and not a Graphics Master.
[/quote]

I didn’t say it was perfect, but it’s better than most people could do…[/quote]

Wasn’t being mean, you’ve accomplished more than most idiots in the graphics section could ever imagine doing. These guys brush pictures, you made a widely accepted Macro.
